item.title: Massimo Vignelli's Signed 2012 NYC Subway Diagram
item.description:
Massimo Vignelli's Signed 2012 NYC Subway Diagram

Less than one year ago, the world lost one of its most important creative minds with the passing of Massimo Vignelli. The celebrated graphic designer bestowed upon us a great number of now-iconic designs, though perhaps none more visibly lasting than his 1972 MTA New York City Transit subway map.

item.title: 50 Apps and Websites to Optimize Your Vacation
item.description:
50 Apps and Websites to Optimize Your Vacation

Everyone has an airport horror story. But you can make the most of a bad situation with apps like Flight+, which will keep you abreast of the latest delays and gate changes. And if you need a shower, unlimited Wi-Fi, or a work space during your extended layover, LoungeBuddy will alert you as to which free and pay-as-you-go lounges are available.

item.title: Spotify's Design Lead on Why Side Projects Should Be Stupid
item.description:
Spotify's Design Lead on Why Side Projects Should Be Stupid

Tobias van Schneider lives his life like one big side project. Today, he designs and builds new products for Spotify in New York, but he couldn't have predicted that when he dropped out of school at age 15 to work as an apprentice in a computer shop in Austria.

item.title: Treehouse Chocolate's Four Drinking Chocolates
item.description:
Treehouse Chocolate's Four Drinking Chocolates

Winter may be officially over in the Northern Hemisphere, but that doesn't mean hot chocolate has to disappear from people's radar until temperatures cool again. For some of us, it makes for a viable alternative to coffee in the morning-with some serious sugar and cocoa kick.

item.title: Moleskine's Comprehensive Smart Writing Set
item.description:
Moleskine's Comprehensive Smart Writing Set

At a conference on productivity-which touched on everything from the importance of tech-free alone time to the educational and emotional benefits of writing by hand (as outlined in a series of studies on the subject)- Moleskine unveiled their latest analog-to-digital wonder.

item.title: Photos of Various Food Dishes Flying Through the Air
item.description:
Photos of Various Food Dishes Flying Through the Air

Camden, London-based commercial still life photographer Piotr Gregorczyk likes to play with food and gravity. One concept he has focused on for a number of recent projects is the idea of showing various food dishes flying through the air as they come together on a plate or in a bowl.

item.title: Colossal
item.description:
Colossal

Commercial photographer Sam Kaplan 's latest project, transforms sticks of chewing gum into monumental structures, stacking the sticky treat in shapes that imitate architectural forms. Hundreds of pieces of gum criss cross and stand upwards to create pyramids, columns, and arches-held tightly together with support from super glue.

item.title: Airbnb's Coolest Tiny Houses in America
item.description:
Airbnb's Coolest Tiny Houses in America

Tiny homes are all the rage, so it makes perfect sense that tiny homes people list on Airbnb are also quite popular. And that's…
